catid="urn:contact.sr.unh.edu:f3e59ec7-27fc-3887-89f2-eb8370940822">Bathymetric Contour Intervals</title> <edition>One</edition> <geoform>vector digital data</geoform> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Concord, New Hampshire</pubplace> <publish>New Hampshire Department of Environmental Services</publish> </pubinfo> <othercit>None</othercit> <onlink><URL:http://www.granit.unh.edu/cgi-bin/nhsearch?dset=bathymetry_p/nh></onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract> Provides bathymetric depth contours in feet and areas of those contour intervals for New Hampshire lakes surveyed by the New Hampshire Department of Environmental Services since 2000. </abstract> <purpose> To calculate lake volume for lake trophic classification and to provide lake stakeholders with a bathymetric map. </purpose> <supplinf>Data distribution tile: statewide</supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <rngdates> <begdate>2000</begdate> <enddate>2011</enddate> </rngdates> </timeinfo> <current>Publication Date</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>Annually</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-72.488920</westbc> <eastbc>-70.729146</eastbc> <northbc>45.224570</northbc> <southbc>42.697692</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Category</themekt> <themekey>Environment</themekey> </theme> <theme> <themekt>None</themekt> <themekey>Depth</themekey> <themekey>Bathymetry</themekey> <themekey>Lake</themekey> <themekey>Pond</themekey> <themekey>Depth Contour</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekt>None</placekt> <placekey>United States</placekey> <placekey>Northeast</placekey> <placekey>New England</placekey> <placekey>New Hampshire</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>None</accconst> <useconst> The data provide a rough estimate of a lake's depth contours and SHOULD NOT be used for navigational purposes.  Reference NHDES as the source of the data is required in any published use of the data.  User is required to read metadata completely before using the data; The information provided in this coverage is a subset of spatial databases developed by the New Hampshire Department of Environmental Services (DES). Development of these databases is an ongoing project; they may not contain all existing and potential sites, stations, or threats. The DES is not responsible for the use or interpretation of this information, or for any inaccuracies in the site names, tax map and lot information, or locations.  All information is subject to verification. These data are to be used for planning purposes only; distribution is discouraged. </useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Scott Ashley</cntper> <cntorg>New Hampshire Department of Environmental Services</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>Biology Section Database Manager</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype> <address>29 Hazen Drive, PO Box 95</address> <city>Concord</city> <state>NH</state> <postal>03302</postal> <country>US</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>603-271-3503</cntvoice> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <native>Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000</native> </idinfo> <dataqual> <logic> The points were plotted over USGS topographic quads and reviewed for positional accuracy as well as thoroughness of coverage for the water body being mapped. </logic> <complete> The data are complete as of the publication date and will be updated with additional water bodies on an annual basis. </complete> <lineage> <procstep> <procdesc> The data was gathered using a GARMIN GPSMAP 168 sounder using North American Datum 83.  Waypoints collected were downloaded using Garmin MapSource software and converted to text. The points were imported and projected to NH State Plane using ArcGIS 9's ArcToolBox  The points are imported and projected to NH State Plane using ArcTool Box.  Using Spatial Analyst and 3-D Analyst the points are converted to a tin.  The tin is used to create a raster that can be used to create accurate contours for each lake </procdesc> <procdate>20061020</procdate> </procstep> <procstep> <procdesc> Data submitted by NH Fish and Game was assigned the appropriate AUIDs and incorporated into the rest of the bathymetry.  Data that overlapped with existing bathymetry was not used. </procdesc> <procdate>20061020</procdate> </procstep> </lineage> </dataqual> <spref> <horizsys> <planar> <gridsys> <gridsysn>State Plane Coordinate System 1983</gridsysn> <spcs> <spcszone>New Hampshire</spcszone> <transmer> <sfctrmer>0.999967</sfctrmer> <longcm>-71.666667</longcm> <latprjo>42.500000</latprjo> <feast>984250.000000</feast> <fnorth>0.000000</fnorth> </transmer> </spcs> </gridsys> <planci> <plance>Coordinate pair</plance> <coordrep> <absres>0.000208</absres> <ordres>0.000208</ordres> </coordrep> <plandu>Survey Feet</plandu> </planci> </planar> <geodetic> <horizdn>North American Datum of 1983</horizdn> <ellips>GRS 80</ellips> <semiaxis>6378137.000000</semiaxis> <denflat>298.257222</denflat> </geodetic> </horizsys> </spref> <eainfo> <detailed> <enttyp> <enttypl>bathy_p</enttypl> <enttypd>Bathymetric contour intervals for lakes surveyed by NHDES.</enttypd> Not intended for legal purposes.  The data provide a rough estimate of a lake's depth contours and SHOULD NOT be used for navigational purposes.  Reference NHDES as the source of the data is required in any published use of the data. </distliab> <stdorder> <digform> <digtinfo> <formname>ESRI shapefile</formname> <transize>29.170</transize> </digtinfo> <digtopt> <onlinopt> <computer> <networka> <networkr>http://www.des.state.nh.us</networkr> </networka> </computer> </onlinopt> </digtopt> </digform> <fees>No Fee for standard export</fees> <ordering> Most coverages are available through ftp site (see Online Linkage).  To address homeland security concerns, access to some of these data sets is available only to users who present a valid personal identification number (PIN) and password.  These data sets have an access constraint set to Upon NHDES Approval.  Users can apply for a PIN and password using the OneStop Data Retrieval  Registration Form (http://www.des.state.nh.us/gis/onestop/). Applicants should be very specific when providing information on the registration form to enable NHDES personnel to determine their eligibility.  For more information on what criteria is necessary to receive a PIN/password please visit http://www.des.state.nh.us/factsheets/co/co-14.htm. Once the applicant has been provided a PIN/Password, the applicant shall be the sole responsible party for the information they receive using the PIN/Password that has been issued to said party. The applicant shall be responsible for the accuracy of the information submitted in a request for a PIN and Password that will allow said applicant to access certain information held by the Department of Environmental Services. The applicant shall understand by submitting a registration form, said applicant shall be responsible for the PIN and Password they receive and for any and all information collected using the PIN and Password, and that NO LIABILITY IS INCURRED BY THE STATE by reason of providing the requested access. </ordering> </stdorder> </distinfo> <metainfo> <metd>20110729</metd> <metrd>20111205</metrd> <metc> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>NH Department of Environmental Services</cntorg> <cntper>George Hastings</cntper> </cntorgp> <cntaddr> <addrtype>Mailing and physical address</addrtype> <address>29 Hazen Drive, PO Box 95</address> <city>Concord</city> <state>NH</state> <postal>03302</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>603-271-3503</cntvoice> </cntinfo> </metc> <metstdn>FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata</metstdn> <metstdv>FGDC-STD-001-1998</metstdv> <mettc>local time</mettc> </metainfo> </metadata>
